description: Plants are a diverse and important group of organisms. This course considers their evolution,
emphasizing the morphology and anatomy of flowering plants. Students learn about basic
techniques of data collection and analysis to investigate plant evolution: identifying plants,
dissecting and staining plant structures, and using computer-based taxonomic statistics programs.
Students attend lectures plus one three-hour laboratory per week.  Prerequisites: Biology 150, or
Biology 125 and 126, or Chemistry/Biology 125-227 and Biology 126. Counts as "comparative
